intro: Convolvulus geranioides, commonly known as the common bindweed, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a trailing herbaceous perennial that produces small, tubular flowers in shades of pink to purple. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces berries that are typically red when mature. It is known for its aggressive growth habit and can become invasive in certain environments. Botanically, it belongs to the family Convolvulaceae, which includes many species with similar climbing or trailing growth patterns.
